conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the small ball at the highest point P.
Vertical component of initial velocity v0 is zero at highest point P.
Horizontal component of velocity remains constant due to absence of horizontal forces.
Initial velocity v0 is 4 m/s and entire initial velocity is horizontal.
Horizontal component of velocity at highest point is 4 m/s.
Ball is moving in a circular path with radius L = 0.5 m at highest point P.
Centripetal force required at highest point is Fc = mv^2/L.
Mass of ball m = 1 kg and horizontal velocity v = 4 m/s.
Gravitational force acting on ball is Fg = mg = 10 N.
Net force exerted by ball on rod is Fnet = Fc - Fg = 22 N.
Centripetal force and gravitational force are directed downward.
Direction of net force is downward.
Magnitude of force exerted by ball on rod at highest point P is 22 N, direction is downward.
